resource_dependency.chessboard_component: A reusable chessboard component that renders SVG or canvas-based board with piece positions
resource_dependency.move_validation_logic: Logic implementing standard chess movement rules (e.g., pawn double-step, castling, en passant)
resource_dependency.websocket_api: WebSocket connection for real-time updates between players

function: Interactive chessboard allowing users to move pieces according to chess rules
static_description: A responsive chessboard grid consisting of 8x8 squares alternating between light and dark colors, populated with standard chess pieces in starting positions. Board theme is initially set to default.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a piece selects it, highlighting possible legal moves. Clicking a highlighted square moves the selected piece there.
Dragging a piece from its current square to a valid destination square executes the move after validation against chess rules.

resource_dependency.create_game_api: POST /api/games endpoint expecting user session token
resource_dependency.game_list_api: GET /api/games/list endpoint returning paginated list of public games awaiting opponents

function: Functionality for users to create new chess games
static_description: A modal dialog titled 'New Game Setup' containing options to configure board theme, difficulty level, and whether the game is private or public.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the 'Create New Game' button opens the setup modal. Clicking 'Confirm' submits the configuration via POST request to backend and redirects to the game lobby.

resource_dependency.game_list_refresh_api: GET /api/games/list?refresh=true polling mechanism to update available games

function: Functionality for users to join existing chess games
static_description: A dedicated page section displaying a table of open games with columns for opponent name, time created, and join status indicators.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking a row's 'Join' button sends a PUT request to associate the authenticated user as the second player and navigates to the active game screen.
Scrolling down triggers additional fetch requests to load more available games dynamically.

resource_dependency.undo_move_api: POST /api/moves/undo endpoint which validates turn ownership before reverting last move

function: Ability for users to undo their last move
static_description: An 'Undo Move' button positioned beneath the chessboard, disabled until a valid move has been made by the current player.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking the enabled 'Undo Move' button triggers a confirmation prompt. Confirming sends a POST request to revert the previous move and updates the local board state accordingly.

resource_dependency.resign_game_api: POST /api/games/{id}/resign endpoint accepting reason field and updating game outcome

function: Option for users to resign from a game
static_description: A clearly visible 'Resign' button located above the chessboard alongside other control elements.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Resign' displays a modal confirming intent. Confirming sends a POST request marking the game as resigned and transitions the UI to show results.

function: Interface controls for selecting different board themes
static_description: A horizontal toggle group below the main navigation bar labeled 'Board Theme', featuring four distinct visual style options represented by small preview images.

interaction_and_states.description: Selecting any option applies the corresponding visual styling immediately across the board and persists the choice through an API call.

resource_dependency.difficulty_change_api: PATCH /api/user/settings/difficulty endpoint affecting AI engine behavior

function: Interface controls for selecting difficulty levels
static_description: Adjacent to the theme selector, another toggle group labeled 'Difficulty Level' showing ascending complexity labels with associated slider position indicator.

interaction_and_states.description: Choosing a difficulty setting adjusts internal parameters used during AI-driven gameplay and saves this preference to user profile.

resource_dependency.game_history_api: GET /api/games/{id}/history returning chronological list of formatted algebraic notation moves
resource_dependency.move_formatter_utility: Utility translating internal move representation into human-readable form

function: Display area showing game history including all moves made
static_description: A vertically scrollable sidebar panel on the right side of the screen listing each completed move with timestamps and player identifiers.

interaction_and_states.description: Scrolling within the history panel reveals earlier turns without triggering additional network activity.

resource_dependency.player_stats_api: GET /api/users/me/stats providing aggregate metrics like total_games_played, wins, losses, draws, average_game_length_minutes
resource_dependency.stats_visualizer_component: Component rendering bar charts, pie graphs, or simple numeric summaries

function: Section for viewing player statistics such as wins, losses, and win rate
static_description: Dedicated tabbed interface accessible from user menu, presenting statistical overviews using graphical representations and numerical summaries.

interaction_and_states.description: Switching tabs loads different categories of stats (overall performance, recent trends, etc.) from cached or fetched data.

resource_dependency.websocket_connection: Established WebSocket link to receive push notifications about board changes
resource_dependency.sync_state_handler: Handler reconciling incoming events with current client-side game model

function: Real-time synchronization of game state between players
static_description: Transparent overlay message indicating live connectivity status ('Connected' or 'Reconnecting...') placed at bottom-right corner.

interaction_and_states.description: Upon receiving move/resignation/undo event over WebSocket, the local board state updates instantly and animations reflect changes seamlessly.

resource_dependency.authentication_api: POST /api/auth/login with email/password payload returning JWT-like session identifier

function: User authentication system to manage player sessions
static_description: Top navigation bar includes a login/logout widget showing either 'Sign In' link or currently logged-in username with avatar placeholder.

interaction_and_states.description: Clicking 'Sign In' redirects to login page. After successful submission, redirect back to origin route with updated session context.

function: Responsive layout styled with alice blue background and steel blue interface elements
static_description: Entire viewport features alice blue (#F0F8FF) background color while primary interactive components use steel blue (#4682B4) accents throughout.

interaction_and_states.description: Layout reflows appropriately when browser window dimensions cross defined breakpoints, maintaining usability across devices.

resource_dependency.package_json_structure: { "scripts": { "install:all": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm install\" \"cd backend && npm install\"", "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" } }

function: Configuration in package.json to install dependencies for both frontend and backend with 'npm run install:all'
static_description: Root-level package.json file specifying two custom scripts under the 'scripts' property enabling unified dependency installation command execution.

resource_dependency.package_json_dev_script: { "scripts": { "dev": "concurrently \"cd frontend && npm run dev\" \"cd backend && npm run dev\"" } }

function: Configuration in package.json to start both frontend and backend concurrently with 'npm run dev'
static_description: Same root package.json defines a development script launching both applications simultaneously using concurrent process management tool.

resource_dependency.frontend_data_fetcher: Axios/fetch wrapper handling GET/POST requests with automatic retry logic
resource_dependency.backend_api_routes: RESTful endpoints defined in Express/Koa routing modules exposing CRUD operations for games, users, moves, sessions

function: A frontend application that fetches all dynamic data from backend APIs
static_description: Frontend app built using React/Vue/Angular framework structured around centralized data fetching utilities communicating exclusively with designated backend services.

resource_dependency.database_connection_pool: Node.js pg/pg-promise/knex connection pool initialized with provided credentials

function: A backend application connecting to a PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
static_description: Backend service written in Node.js leveraging ORM or raw SQL drivers to establish persistent connections to remote PostgreSQL instance configured via injected environment settings.
